text: "Big Machine" is a song by the Goo Goo Dolls, first released on their Gutterflower album in 2002. It was written by lead vocalist/guitarist Johnny Rzeznik, who calls it his "disco song" and describes its meaning as "a propulsive tale of unrequited love". This song's drums were on a drum machine, and it was called "Disco". This song was written about the people in LA, and the way of life, as told on VH1's Storytellers.Gutterflower#"Big Machine" ==Track listings== U.S. Promo CD #"Big Machine" - 3:10 Australian CD Single #"Big Machine" - 3:10 #"Black Balloon" - 4:01 #"Broadway" - 3:50 ==Live versions== The song was performed live as the opener for the band's Independence Day concert, and was filmed for the Live in Buffalo: July 4th 2004 DVD release. ==Chart positions== {| class="wikitable" !align="left"|Chart (2002) !align="left"|Peak position |-z |align="left"|U.S. Billboard Hot 100 |align="center"|64 |- |align="left"|U.S. Billboard Adult Top 40 |align="center"|10 |- |align="left"|U.S. Billboard Pop Songs |align="center"|31 |- |align="left"|U.S. Billboard Radio Songs |align="center"|69 |- |Australia (ARIA Charts) |align="center"|77 |- |} ==References== ==External links== * Category:2002 singles Category:Goo Goo Dolls songs Category:Songs written by John Rzeznik Category:Song recordings produced by Rob Cavallo
